RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 1 5 1/2F Turf CR: 80. Maiden Special Weight Purse 88000. FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Weight, 119 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at Five and One Half Furlongs on the Main Track).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SPLIT STRIKE stalked the pace on the outside then in the three path on the turn, was asked coming to the quarter-pole, took the lead in upper stretch, shook clear outside the sixteenth-pole and held under steady urging. MARCO T. moved in outside the nine-sixteenths, was well placed while rated just off the pace, saved ground on the turn, was given her cue at the five-sixteenths, swung four wide into upper stretch, chased the winner into the final furlong, gained into the final sixteenth and finished well but missed while clear for the place. RED BURGUNDY was hustled to the front, showed the way down the backstretch, vied in the two path on the turn, was asked near the quarter-pole, lost the advantage under a drive in upper stretch, battled with the winner into the final furlong and weakened but was clear for the show. WOKE UP QUICK came away from the gate under urging, was taken up while having his path taken outside the nine-sixteenths then dropped back while climbing, moved out then leveled out some around the half-mile pole, traveled around the turn in the two path and lacked the needed response. DIXIE PHARAOH settled under some urging, went three then four wide on the turn and failed to threaten. PLAY FREE BIRD was coaxed along off the pace, saved ground on the turn and was no factor. SOLO RYE'D shied outward and was off a step slow, was urged along at the back on the outside, went around the turn in the three path and failed to impact. WINE RESPONSIBLY leaned in at the start and was off a step slow, was urged along on the outside, went three wide on the turn and came up empty. KHADULLAH broke out at the start, was rated just off the pace under snug restraint, came under urging in the two path on the turn, spun four wide into the stretch while just off the heels of a rival and capitulated. STATE OF READINESS was a bit fractious behind the gate, dropped back while climbing some early, saved ground on the turn and showed little.

ENTRY.NAME: Woke Up Quick
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,urged,tkn up 4-1/2,climbed,mvd out,2p turn,no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Red Burgundy
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,pace,2p turn,asked1/4,headed3/16,vied past 1/8,wknd

ENTRY.NAME: State of Readiness
ENTRY.COMMENT: bit fractious behind gate,climbed early,ins turn,no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Play Free Bird
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed along, inside turn, no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Marco T.
ENTRY.OWNER: Caruso Michael J and Dubb Michael
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated just off pace,ins turn,swung 4w into upper,closed well,miss

ENTRY.NAME: Split Strike
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked outside,3path turn,ask1/4,lead3/16,clear out1/16,held

ENTRY.NAME: Dixie Pharaoh
ENTRY.OWNER: West Paces Racing LLC and Hoffman Thoroughbreds
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled some urging,3-4wide turn,no threat

ENTRY.NAME: Khadullah
ENTRY.OWNER: Rodriguez, Rudy R. and Imperio, Michael
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke out,rated just off pace,2p turn,4p3/16,off heels,empty

ENTRY.NAME: Wine Responsibly
ENTRY.OWNER: Broman Sr Chester and Broman Mary
ENTRY.COMMENT: lean in brk,off step slow,urged outside,3w turn,empty

ENTRY.NAME: Solo Rye'd
ENTRY.OWNER: Bourbon Lane Stable (J Hill M McMahon) Empire Equines LLC Seidman Stables LLC Am
ENTRY.COMMENT: shied out,off step slow,urged outside,3p turn,no factor

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 2 1 1/8M Dirt CR: 98. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 149500. (PURSE $115,000 FOR NON-NYB) (UP TO $26,013 NYSBFOA) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR OPTIONAL CLAIMING PRICE O F $50,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Other Than Claiming Or Starter At A Mile Or Over Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $50,000 (Allowance Horses Preferred)(1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise ClaimW ill Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JUST KATHERINE came out slightly with eight and a half furlongs to go and jostled TOWER BRIDGE forcing both WISHING ON A STAR and COPPA GIRL to steady off the heels of rivals and alter out into the first turn, chased three then two wide coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, took the inside route into upper stretch, rallied to take command just inside the three-sixteenths and edged away under a drive kept to task. RAGING SEA brushed at the start by MARIAH'S APPEAL, who broke outwards, raced three wide through the first turn and then chased five then four wide advancing on the leader in tandem with MARIAH'S APPEAL to overthrow the front at the three-eighths, swung three to four wide into upper stretch, took narrow and brief command at the three-sixteenths before being headed by the top one, dug in tussling briefly before being shaken off, ran on to chase the winner home well clear of the rest and along second best. MARIAH'S APPEAL broke out at the start brushing RAGING SEA, raced three wide through the first turn, chased four then three wide advancing on the leader to take command under coaxing at the three-eighths already under challenge to the outside, swung three then two wide into upper stretch yielding the front, then weakened through the final furlong while well clear of the rest for the show honors. TONED UP chased along the inside and then just off the inside coming under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths, angled five to six wide into upper stretch and weakened. AMANDA'S FOLLY a bit fractious in the gate, showed the way in hand just off the inside, tucked inside into the far turn, got displaced from the front at the three-eighths and faded, continued inside into upper stretch and tired. COPPA GIRL got steadied off the heels of rivals eight and half furlongs out when JUST KATHERINE jostled for a lane with TOWER BRIDGE to the inside, altered out five wide into the first turn before being able to tuck to the two path, chased three to four wide down the backstretch and into the far turn coming under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths, swung three to four wide for home and made no impact. TOWER BRIDGE coaxed from the gate, raced three to four wide past the stands early on and jostled with JUST KATHERINE getting bumped by that rival eight and a half furlongs out and forcing to rivals outside to steady off heels unable to tuck inwards to her outside, tucked to chase along the inside coming under coaxing at the half mile pole, spun just off the inside into upper stretch and faltered. WISHING ON A STAR steadied off the heels of a rival and altered four wide pushing COPPA GIRL to go five wide into the first turn when a pair of rivals jostled for one lane to their inside, chased five to six wide under coaxing from the seven-sixteenths, swung five wide for home and made no impact.

ENTRY.NAME: Toned Up
ENTRY.OWNER: Dubb Michael Bouchey Steven and America's Pastime Stables
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside, coaxed 2p 7/16, 5-6w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Amanda's Folly
ENTRY.COMMENT: bit fractious gate, in hand 2p, yielded ins 3/8, ins 1/4, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Just Katherine
ENTRY.COMMENT: jostled foes 8 1/2, chased 3-2w, ins 1/4, up ins 3/16, edged away

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Boyd Brooks, Louis Brooks Ranch LimitedPartnership, Hugh O

ENTRY.NAME: Tower Bridge
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, bumped 8 1/2, chased ins, 2w 1/4p, faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Wishing On a Star
ENTRY.COMMENT: steady 8 1/2, alter 4w into 1st, chased 5-6w, 5w uppr, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Coppa Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: steady 8 1/2F, chased 3-4w, 3-4w upper, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Mariah's Appeal
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out st, 3w 1st turn, chased 4-3w, up 3/8, 3-2w uppr, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Raging Sea
ENTRY.COMMENT: brushed st, 3w 1st turn, chased 5-4w, 3-4w uppr, up 3/16, ran on

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Bernard Baruch S. SARATOGA RACE 3 1 1/16M Inner turf CR: 102. Stakes Purse 150000. INNER TURF FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Non-Lasix race pursuant to 4043.2 (7)(e)(5) Lasix not permitted within 48 hours of post time. By subscription of $150 each which should accompany the nomination; $750 to pass the entry box and an additional $750 to start. For horses not originally nominated, a supplemental payment of $750 in addition to the entry and starting fees may be made at any time prior to the closing of entries. The purse to be divided 55% to the winner, 20% to second, 12% to third, 6% to fourth, 4% to fifth and 3% divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners of a Graded sweepstakes in 2023 allowed 2 lbs.; of a sweepstakes other than State-bred in 2023 allowed 4 lbs.; of two races other than maiden, claimi ng, starter or State-bred allowance in 2023 allowed 6 lbs. A Trophy will be presented to the winning owner. The New York Racing Association reserves the right to transfer this race to the Main Track. Closed Saturday, August 19, 2023 with 17 Original Nomin
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PIONEERING SPIRIT broke out and bumped with a rival at the start then was corrected, was taken under a snug hold early then rated on the inside, angled three wide near the five-sixteenths, gained to make an outside bid into upper stretch, fought outside of two opponents into the final furlong, disposed of those foes coming to the sixteenth-pole and drew clear under steady urging. BRING ME A CHECK went to the front, was well rated while setting the pace on the inside, came under urging while under threat on the far turn, lost the advantage outside the quarter-pole, battled inside of two foes under a drive into the final furlong, lost touch with the winner into the final sixteenth and proved no match but kept on willingly to earn the place honors. PUBLIC SECTOR (GB) stumbled at the start then bumped with a rival, was taken under a tight hold while between horses early, saved ground on the first turn, settled at the rear, was roused while inside on the far turn, came three wide into the stretch under a drive, remained on his inside lead until outside the furlong marker then swapped to the proper lead and lacked the needed kick then just missed the place but narrowly earned the show. EMARAATY (GB) stalked the pace on the outside in the two path, engaged the leader on the far turn, took the advantage outside the quarter-pole, was asked for his best in upper stretch, battled between horses into the final furlong, dropped back into the final sixteenth and weakened. WIT dropped off the pace while not asked for early speed, went two to three wide on the first turn, settled on the outside without the benefit of cover, came under coaxing near the half-mile pole, was roused three then four wide while on the far turn, turned into upper stretch under a drive and lacked the needed response.

ENTRY.NAME: Bring Me a Check
ENTRY.COMMENT: to front,well rated,inside,ask 2nd trn,headed1/4,no match,kept on

ENTRY.NAME: Pioneering Spirit
ENTRY.COMMENT: snug hold,rated inside,angled 3w5/16,bid3/16,drew clear last1/16

ENTRY.NAME: Public Sector (GB)
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled brk,bmpd,in hand btwn,ins1st,settld,ask ins2nd,

ENTRY.NAME: Wit
ENTRY.OWNER: Repole Stable St Elias Stable and Gainesway Stable (Antony Beck)
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2-3p1st,settled outside,no cover,roused 3-4w2nd,no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Emaraaty (GB)
ENTRY.OWNER: Dubb Michael Madaket Stables LLC and Caruso Michael J
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked outside 2path,lead outside 1/4,vied btwn past 1/8,wknd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 4 7F Dirt CR: 96. Claiming Purse 72000. (UP TO $12,528 NYSBFOA) FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Weight, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races In 2023 Allowed 3 lbs. A Race In 2023 Allowed 5 lbs. Claiming Price $40,000 (Maiden And Claiming Races For $32,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: Following a shoe repair in the paddock, SWIFTSURE established the front from the get go and showed the way in hand just off the inside, got set down spinning two to three wide into upper stretch, drew off under a drive to prevail. SAGAMORE MISCHIEF chased three wide under coaxing from the five-sixteenths, swung four wide into upper stretch, proved no match for the top one and ran on to secure the place honors. JEMOGRAPHY brushed the off side stall at the start, chased along the inside under coaxing from the seven-sixteenths, spun just off the inside into upper stretch and weakened in the late stages. SCILLY CAY chased two to three wide coming under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths, angled four to five wide into upper stretch, offered no response. ROYAL TRYST four to five paths off the inside down the backstretch, tucked to the two path into the turn coming under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths, continued just off the inside for home and offered no rally. FLOAT ON got bumped at the start by FLINT RIDGE, chased two to three wide down the backstretch and then four wide through the turn under coaxing from the seven-sixteenths, went six wide into upper stretch and weakened. FLINT RIDGE stumbled at the start, recovered inwards bumping FLOAT ON, chased along the inside down the backstretch and then three wide through the turn under coaxing from the three-eighths, angled five wide into upper stretch and weakened. SENOR JOBIM three to four wide in pursuit, got coaxed along with seven-sixteenths to go, tipped five to six wide into upper stretch and was unable to make an impact.

ENTRY.NAME: Float On
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped st, chased 2-3w, coaxed 4w 7/16, 6w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Flint Ridge
ENTRY.OWNER: Gurdon Andrew O Poyah Anil and Rodriguez Gustavo
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled st, chased ins, coaxed 3w 3/8, 5w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Jemography
ENTRY.OWNER: Epona Racing Stable Jasinski Clyde X and Toga Party Racing Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: brush gate st, chased ins, coaxed 7/16, 2w 1/4p, wknd late

ENTRY.NAME: Scilly Cay
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 2-3w, coaxed 7/16, angled 4-5w upper, no response

ENTRY.NAME: Sagamore Mischief
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w pursuit, coaxed 5/16, 4w upper, no match, ran on

ENTRY.NAME: Swiftsure
ENTRY.OWNER: Liberty House Racing Twenty-Two Stable Club Sixty Five Racing Take a Shot Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: in hand 2p, set down 2-3w upper, drew off

ENTRY.NAME: Senor Jobim
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3-4w pursuit, coaxed 7/16, 5-6w upper, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Royal Tryst
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4-5w backstretch, coaxed 2p 7/16, 2w 1/4p, no rally

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 5 5 1/2F Turf CR: 84. Maiden Special Weight Purse 88000. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at Five and One Half Furlongs on the Main Track).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RUSSI was rated off the pace while tugging at the bit, moved out near the seven-sixteenths, was let out three wide on the turn, bumped with a rival while five wide into upper stretch, rallied outside to get the lead at the furlong marker, disposed of two foes into the final sixteenth and held off the runner-up under strong urging. SCHERZANDO settled off the pace, went two then three wide on the turn, came five wide into the stretch while just off the heels of a rival, tipped out for clear space shortly thereafter, rallied outside in the final furlong and closed well to just miss while clear for the place. BUSTINO SANTINO was sent hard from the start, pressed the pace while well out in the course, angled in late on the backstretch, vied in the two path while on even terms for the lead on the turn, bumped with a rival coming to the quarter-pole, spun three wide into the stretch, battled under a drive into the final furlong, dropped back into the final sixteenth and was outfinished while just able to get the show. OKALOOSA was sent hard to the front, showed the way along the hedge, lost action leaving the backstretch, bumped with a foe coming to the quarter-pole, spun a bit off the inside into upper stretch, fought under a drive into the final furlong, dropped back into the final sixteenth and was out-kicked. RIPE FOR MISCHIEF was urged along on the outside, went five wide on the turn, turned into upper stretch under a drive, switched back to his inside lead near the sixteenth-pole and improved position. VOLEUSE broke a half-step slow, was hustled from the gate then urged along off the pace, moved closer with a half-mile to run, chased inside on the turn, cut the corner into the stretch, pursued the leaders against the hedge into the final furlong, moved out near the sixteenth-pole and lacked the needed kick. VAUNTED chased the pace, went around the turn in the two path, bumped with a rival while coming out four wide into the stretch, dropped back into the final furlong and tired. HERONEANDONLY settled under some urging, went three wide on the turn, came four wide into the stretch then moved further out and failed to threaten. DOCTOR JERRY hit the inside of the gate then bumped with a foe, was urged along off the pace, dropped back near the half-mile pole, moved from the two path to the rail on the turn and failed to threaten. PRINCE OF TRUTH broke out and bumped with a foe, chased the pace on the outside then four wide on the turn and capitulated. SONDSLIKSOMDINIDDO leapt through the front of the gate prior to the start then was brought back around and reloaded after being deemed fit to run by the state veterinarian, leapt in the air at the start and was off very slow, went two to three wide on the turn and trailed.

ENTRY.NAME: Russi
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated,moved out 7/16,3w turn,bmpd 5w1/4,rallied,lead1/8,held

ENTRY.NAME: Ripe for Mischief
ENTRY.COMMENT: urged along outside,5wide turn,improved position

ENTRY.OWNER: Valente, Roddy J. and Bilinski, Darlene
ENTRY.COMMENT: hit gate,bmpd,urged,drop back 1/2,2path-ins turn,no threat

ENTRY.NAME: Bustino Santino
ENTRY.COMMENT: sent hard,pressed outside,mvd in7/16,2p turn,bmp1/4,3p,outfnshd

ENTRY.OWNER: Eclipse Thoroughbred Partners and Glebe Ventures
ENTRY.COMMENT: sent hard,ins pace,lost action7/16,bmpd1/4,2p,outkicked

ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,urged,closer1/2,ins turn,chased hedge,mvd out1/16,no kick

ENTRY.NAME: Vaunted
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace,2path turn,bmpd1/4,4w into lane,tired

ENTRY.NAME: Scherzando
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled,2-3path turn,5w1/4,tipped out,rallied outside,clsd well

ENTRY.NAME: Prince of Truth
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke out,bmpd,chased outside,4wide turn,tired

ENTRY.NAME: Heroneandonly
ENTRY.OWNER: Simeone Paul J Joyce Kevin DeVaney Randall and Cartier Cohen
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled some urging,3wide turn,4w1/4,mvd out,no threat

ENTRY.NAME: Sondsliksomdiniddo
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke through gate,leapt brk,off very slow,2-3p,no factor

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 6 6F Dirt CR: 80. Maiden Special Weight Purse 88000. FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Weight, 119 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BONNE CHANCE coaxed from the gate, chased along the inside coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, spun just off the inside into upper stretch and had WISECRACKER drift in directly in front and was forced to steady off that foes heels losing all momentum and altering in briefly, tipped out to the four path at the three-sixteenths roused once more by the rider and issued a challenge coming again to surge to the front near the sixteenth marker, then drew clear showing good courage to prevail impressively at the end. SOLO'S FURY bobbled at the start recovering outwards and was bumped and brushed by ARCO AUGUSTA due to pressure from WINWOOD veering inwards, got hustled along soon after and chased five then four wide coaxed along from the get go, advanced on the leader in tandem with WISECRACKER nearing the quarter pole, swung three wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive seizing narrow command a furlong out, got headed by the eventual winner and SORORITY PRANK near the sixteenth marker, ran on to come again mildly for the place honors. SORORITY PRANK coaxed from the gate, dueled inside of WINWOOD from the get go, got set down under pressure from a pair taking the inside route into upper stretch, dug in and was caught a furlong out, fought on inside trading the place spot briefly, then was along safe for the show honors. DIANNESRETIRING coaxed from the gate, chased along the inside under coaxing from the three-eighths, spun two to three wide for home, kept on to secure the last major share. ARCO AUGUSTA got bumped at the start by WINWOOD veering in and bumped and brushed SOLO'S FURY, chased six paths off the inside down the backstretch and then three then two wide through the turn under coaxing from midway, swung four wide for home and kept on to the finish. WISECRACKER coaxed from the gate, chased three wide advancing under coaxing at the five-sixteenths in tandem with SOLO'S FURY, drifted in spinning just off the inside into upper stretch forcing BONNE CHANCE to steady off his heels straightened away, then weakened through to the finish. AZ U CHASE ME chased three to four wide under prolonged encouragement from the half mile pole, swung four to five wide into upper stretch and tired. SMILE TAKES CHARGE coaxed from the start, chased just off the inside until tucked inside at the half mile pole, came under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths, took the inside route into upper stretch and made no impact. NIPPY FITZ chased two to three wide coming under coaxing at the half mile pole, swung three to four wide for home, made no impact. WINWOOD veered in at the start bumping ARCO AUGUSTA into SOLO'S FURY, dueled from the two path with SORORITY PRANK to his inside, retreated midway on the turn and cornered just off the inside into upper stretch, then folded in the drive.

ENTRY.NAME: Sorority Prank
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, dueled inside, set down ins 1/4, caught, fought on

ENTRY.NAME: Smile Takes Charge
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased 2p, coaxed 7/16, inside 1/4, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Az U Chase Me
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 3-4w, coaxed 1/2, 4-5w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Diannesretiring
ENTRY.OWNER: Dubb Michael The Elkstone Group LLC (Stuart Grant) and Caruso Michael J
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased ins, coaxed 3/8, 2-3w upper, kept on

ENTRY.NAME: Bonne Chance
ENTRY.OWNER: Flying P Stable and Levine Bruce N
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased ins, steady alter uppr, up 1/16, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: Solo's Fury
ENTRY.OWNER: Greyhound Stables and Dunn Christopher T
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbled, bumped st, coaxed 5-4w, 3w upper, up, collared, ran on

ENTRY.NAME: Arco Augusta
ENTRY.OWNER: C T R Stables LLC (Ferreira) and Amarosa Anthony
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped st, 6w backstretch, 3-2w turn, 4w upper, kept on

ENTRY.NAME: Winwood
ENTRY.COMMENT: veered in st, dueled 2p, retreated 3/8, 2w 1/4p, folded

ENTRY.NAME: Wisecracker
ENTRY.OWNER: Broman Sr Chester and Broman Mary
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased 3w, advanced coaxed 5/16, 2w 1/4p, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Nippy Fitz
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2-3w pursuit, coaxed 1/2, 3-4w upper, no impact

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 7 1 1/16M Inner turf CR: 88. Allowance Purse 95000. INNER TURF FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Other Than Claiming Or Starter At A Mile Or Over Allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WATERVILLE broke in and made light contact with a rival at the start, was bumped on both sides shortly thereafter, went thee wide on the first turn, settled off the pace, was roused four wide on the far turn, came seven wide into the stretch, rallied outside into the final furlong and closed strongly to get up late and prevail. SNOWY EVENING settled in the two path, was asked on the far turn, turned into upper stretch under a drive, gained to make a bid into the final furlong, led into the final sixteenth but was denied while able to get the place. OVERACTING was taken in hand early, rounded the first turn in the four path, tracked the pace on the outside, was asked in the four path on the far turn, made a bid at the five-sixteenths, took the lead in the five path into upper stretch, led to near the sixteenth-pole then was headed, battled with the top two to the finish and missed while able to get the show. CRIMSON PRINCESS was bumped lightly at the start, bumped with rivals on both sides early, moved in towards the rear, rounded the opening bend in the two path, settled towards the back, was roused while moving from the two path to the four path on the far turn, came seven wide into the stretch and improved position while finished with late energy to garner the last spot in the superfecta. SMOKIE EYES was taken in hand early then reserved in the two to three path, came under urging outside the quarter-pole, swung six wide into the stretch, chased the vanguard in the drive and lacked the needed kick. SWEETEST PRINCESS saved ground on the first turn, settled towards the rear, went around the far turn in the two path, came four wide into the stretch then quickly angled further out and also improved position. SPOOKY LADY went to the front, showed the way on the inside, was given her cue on the far turn, turned into the stretch in the two path, lost the advantage near the three-sixteenths, battled under a drive into the final furlong and gave way. SARATOGA CHROME bumped with a rival after the start then checked while pinched back, angled in at the rear, saved ground near the back, was urged on the far turn, swung five wide into the stretch and lacked the needed response. SALS DREAM GIRL was sent hard from the gate, stalked the pace on the outside in the three path, was asked with three furlongs to run, chased on the far turn, spun four wide into the stretch, dropped back into the final furlong and tired. SHESASCOLDASICE drifted in badly at the start then bumped with a rival and bothered several foes, went four wide on the first turn, settled on the outside, was roused three wide on the far turn and failed to respond. JOEYBIGNOSE was bumped after the start and forced into another rival then checked, traveled around the first turn in the two path, settled near the back on the outside, was roused in the two path on the far turn, came six wide into the stretch, drifted in near the furlong marker and was no factor. SHOOPTHEREITIS settled on the inside, came under urging on the far turn and also failed to respond.

ENTRY.NAME: Shoopthereitis
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled inside, asked 2nd turn, no response

ENTRY.NAME: Sweetest Princess
ENTRY.COMMENT: ins1st turn,towards rear,2p2nd turn,4w1/4,angled out,improved

ENTRY.NAME: Spooky Lady
ENTRY.COMMENT: inside pace,asked 2nd turn,2p1/4,headed3/16,vied past1/8,gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Snowy Evening
ENTRY.OWNER: Crist Steven deRegt Ken and Gleaves Philip A
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2path,ask2nd turn,chased,bid,led1/16,denied

ENTRY.NAME: Sals Dream Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: sent,stalked outside 3path,ask3/8,chsd2nd,4w1/4,tired

ENTRY.NAME: Smokie Eyes
ENTRY.OWNER: Reeves Thoroughbred Racing Bilinski Darlene and Rocco Steven
ENTRY.COMMENT: in hand,rated 2-3path,ask1/4,6w into lane,chased,outkicked

ENTRY.NAME: Overacting
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4w1st,tracked outside,4w2nd,bid5/16,5w1/4,led3/16-near1/16,caught

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 8 6F Dirt CR: 94. Allowance Purse 95000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non -winners Of A Race Other Than Claiming Or Starter Allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WIN FOR GOLD brushed at the start by CALLALOO, who broke inwards, raced five paths off the inside down the backstretch just off the pace, advanced in tandem with BE THE BOSS on the leader inside the half mile pole tucked three wide through the turn, had that foe take command just to his inside at the three-eighths, knocked heads and took a narrow advantage at the quarter pole before swinging three to four wide into upper stretch, floated out two paths getting separation on BE THE BOSS while head to head, dueled through to the finish in getting directed back in to look his main rival in the eye near the sixteenth marker and gamely prevailed at the end, the rider with an active right rein being flashed to his charge in the final jumps. BE THE BOSS got bumped at the start by FAST BUCK FREDDY, who recovered inwards from a stumble, chased three to four wide early on just off the leader, tucked to the two path half a mile from home and advanced on the front in concert with the aforementioned foe latching on the leader to now between foes inside the seven-sixteenths, poked a head in front just inside three furlongs to run, spun two to three wide into upper stretch headed briefly by the top one at the quarter pole before getting on near even terms straightened away once more, dug in under a drive dueling through to the finish in game fashion but was ultimately denied at the end. ASYMMETRIC coaxed from the gate, chased three then two wide coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled three to four wide into upper stretch and offered up a mild kick. NEWPORT BRIDGE coaxed from the start, showed the way safely in front early on just off the inside, tucked inside into the turn and came under increased pressure from the top pair getting displaced from the front near three furlongs to go, swung four wide into upper stretch, kept on under a drive to the finish. CALLALOO broke in at the start bumping WIN FOR GOLD and was knocked askew conceding three to four lengths to the front before settling into stride, chased six to seven paths off the inside until tucked inside at the half mile pole, came under coaxing midway on the turn, continued along the inside route into upper stretch and improved position. FAST BUCK FREDDY stumbled at the start recovering inwards and bumped BE THE BOSS, conceded two to three lengths to the front before settling into stride, chased four then three wide coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung four wide into upper stretch and was outkicked. ALWAYS CHARMING six paths off the inside down the backstretch, tucked four wide through the turn coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, went six wide into upper stretch and offered no response. THANK YOU JON broke out at the start and was corrected, chased five to six paths off the inside down the backstretch and then four wide through the turn under coaxing from the three-eighths, went seven wide into upper stretch and made no impact.

ENTRY.NAME: Asymmetric
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased 3-2w, coaxed 5/16, 3-4w upper, mild kick

ENTRY.NAME: Thank You Jon
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out st, 5-6w backstretch, 4w turn, 7w upper, no impact

ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, led early 2p, to ins 1/2, yield 3/8, 4w uppr, kept on

ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped st, 3-4w early, bid 2p btw, 2-3w uppr, dueled str, game

ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled st, chased 4-3w, coaxed 5/16, 4w upper, outkicked

ENTRY.NAME: Callaloo

ENTRY.COMMENT: 6w backstretch, coaxed 4w 3/8, 6w upper, no response

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 9 5 1/2F Turf CR: 82. Maiden Special Weight Purse 136500. (PURSE $105,000 FOR NON-NYB) (UP TO $23,751 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at Five and One Half Furlongs on the Main Track).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: AMERICAN KNOW HOW broke in and bumped hard with a rival, settled off the pace, was roused while moving from the two path to the four path on the turn, came five wide into the stretch, rallied on the outside, lugged in while gaining at the furlong marker then was corrected by the rider, lugged in while closing well to get the lead inside the sixteenth-pole and prevailed while kept off the runner-up by the rider under a strong right-handed grip. ALEXIS ZORBA (GB) bumped with a rival at the start, moved in while going to the front, set the pace under pressure to his outside, vied along the hedge on the turn, shook clear coming to the quarter-pole, led under a drive into the final sixteenth but was caught while clear for the place. IRON MAN JIMMY broke out and brushed the gate then bumped with a foe, settled towards the rear, tossed his head while pulling hard under stout restraint leaving the backstretch, was let out in the two path on the turn, turned into upper stretch under a drive and finished with good courage for the show. BE THERE settled off the pace, shifted from the three path to the five path on the turn, moved out in upper stretch and improved to just miss the show. KASIMBA dropped back then settled on the outside, was roused three wide on the turn, moved out in upper stretch and failed to rally. LIQUID ADDICTION (IRE) tracked the pace on the outside, was asked three wide on the turn, spun four wide into the stretch, chased into the final furlong and tired. OFF THE CLOCK pressed the pace on the outside then in the two path on the turn, dropped back nearing the quarter-pole, spun three wide into the stretch and weakened. COLLECT FROM IKE bumped with foes on both sides at the start, settled on the outside, went four wide on the turn, angled out in upper stretch and was no factor. SOCIAL ACCEPTANCE was bumped hard on both sides at the start, settled towards the rear, saved ground on the turn, steadied at the quarter-pole and never reached contention then was eased late but walked off. BORLETTI (IRE) was away awkwardly, raced just off the pace under restraint, dropped back leaving the backstretch, rounded the turn in the two path and faltered then was eased late but also walked off. TRIUMPHANT ROAD broke out and bumped hard with a rival then stumbled and unseated the rider. FOLLOWING A STEWARDS' INQUIRY INTO THE START, NO CHANGE WAS MADE TO THE ORDER OF FINISH

ENTRY.NAME: Triumphant Road
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke out, bumped hard start, stumbled, lost rider

ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped hard btwn brk,well back,inside turn,stdy1/4,falter,eased

ENTRY.COMMENT: brk in,bmpd hard,settled,2-4w turn,5w1/4,rallied,luggd in,gain,up

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Hopeful S. - Grade1 SARATOGA RACE 10 7F Dirt CR: 102. Stakes Purse 300000. FOR TWO YEAR OLDS. Non-Lasix race pursuant to 4043.2 (7)(e)(5) Lasix not permitted within 48 hours of post time. By subscription of $300 each which should accompany the nomination; $1,500 to pass the entry box and an additional $1,500 to start. For horses not originally nominated, a supplemental payment of $1,500 in addition to the entry and starting fees) may be made at any time prior to the closing of entries. The purse to be divided 55% to the winner, 20% to second, 12% to third, 6% to fourth, 4% to fi fth and 3% divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. Weight 122 lbs. Non-winners of a race other than maiden allowed 2 lbs; maidens allowed 4 lbs. A trophy will be presented to the winning owner, trainer and jockey. Closed Saturday, August 19, 2023 with 26 Nominations.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NUTELLA FELLA the last to be loaded into the gate, grew reluctant to load causing a brief stall to the start, then broke a beat slow and was last away from the gate, chased along the inside at the tail of the field, tipped off the rail to go four to five wide at the three-eighths and then angled back in to the two path when rivals stacked up in front with five-sixteenths to go, spun just off the inside at the quarter pole and darted out to be seven wide into upper stretch to the outside of PIRATE, dug in under a drive rallying to issue a challenge through the final furlong in the clear as rivals stacked up inside and overhauled the front with seventy yards to go before prevailing edging away at the end. TIMBERLAKE got placed to a light hold off heels of the front runners three then two wide midway down the backstretch when pulling on the bit a bit eager, remained two to three wide through the turn coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung three to four wide into upper stretch, was in behind rivals with a tight seam paused at the three-sixteenths, then came on through a furlong out to take command inside that station, dug in under a drive and was collared with seventy yards to the finish and ran on to secure the place honors. PIRATE broke in at the start bumping BE YOU solidly into VALENTINE CANDY, raced eight paths off the inside down the backstretch and then six wide through the turn coming under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths, continued six wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive and drifted in slightly a sixteenth out placing a pair of rivals in tight while keeping on to procure the show honors. BE YOU got bumped solidly at the start by PIRATE and in turn bumped VALENTINE CANDY, chased six paths off the inside down the backstretch and then four wide through the turn coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled five wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive and was forced to pause near the sixteenth marker when PIRATE drifted in, then got urged to the finish to get up for the last major share. MISSION BEACH coaxed from the gate, vied from the five path down the backstretch with a trio and then a pair, tucked to the three path into the turn and knocked heads with JUST STEEL through the bend under coaxing from midway, swung three wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive clinging to the front before being displaced inside the eighth pole, then weakened in the late stages. GOLD SWEEP got bumped at the start by BAYTOWN CHATTERBOX, who broke inwards, chased five then four wide, came under coaxing tucking three wide at the three-eighths, angled out four to five wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive drifting in looking for a seam and briefly had one, then got forced to steady just outside the sixteenth pole as BE YOU paused outside also when PIRATE drifted in closing that lane down and couldn't recover to the finish. JUST STEEL hustled from the start, vied from the three path among a quartet and then a trio, tucked to the two path into the turn and engaged in head to head combat with MISSION BEACH coming under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths, spun just off the inside into upper stretch still engaged in the duel upfront, got overtaken as a pair inside the eighth pole and weakened through to the finish. BAYTOWN CHATTERBOX broke in at the start bumping GOLD SWEEP, chased six then five wide coming under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths, went eight to nine wide into upper stretch and made no headway. VALENTINE CANDY broke out at the start and was bumped by BE YOU due to pressure from PIRATE, chased six then five wide coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, went seven wide into upper stretch and tired. YO YO CANDY coaxed from the gate, vied four wide early on between foes, then got shaken off into the turn and chased four wide under coaxing from the seven-sixteenths, continued four wide into upper stretch and faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Just Steel
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled st, vied 3p early, dueled 2p turn, 2w 1/4p, weakened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 11 1 1/16M Inner turf CR: 78. Maiden Special Weight Purse 88000. INNER TURF FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred) .
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LT. MITCHELL raced in the four path on the first turn, prompted the pace on the outside, vied in the two path on the far turn, was asked at the quarter-pole, took over in the three path into the stretch then kicked clear and drew away under steady urging. FAKE CELEBRITY bumped with a rival at the start, was taken under a snug hold early, saved ground on the first turn, was reserved off the pace, came under urging while two the three wide on the far turn, lugged in while passing foes in the stretch and got up for the place. KID KREESA went to the front, traveled around the first turn in the two path, showed the way down the backstretch, was asked while inside on the far turn, lost the lead into upper stretch and proved no match for the winner then was nailed for the place while able to get the show. MUGSY FURY was rated just off the pace on the inside, saved ground through the far turn, chased under a drive in the stretch and just missed the trifecta. DOLLY'S BANK was taken up while in tight between foes after the start, went three to four wide on the turns and failed to rally. SCARAMANGA went three wide on the first turn, was rated just off the pace, came under urging while two to three wide on the far turn and lacked the needed response. CHULLIGAN swerved out over heels into the first turn, went five then four wide on that bend, settled on the outside, was roused while moving from three to five wide on the far turn and failed to rally. PASCHAL MOON bumped with a foe at the start, lugged out into the first turn then checked, went four then three wide on the first turn, settled off the pace, was roused in the two path on the far turn and came up empty. THE MANTICORE was taken under a tight hold, went around the first turn in the two path, was reserved off the pace, saved ground on the far turn and failed to threaten. UNAFFECTED traveled around the first turn in the two path, was reserved at the rear, saved ground on the far turn, came out into the stretch and was no factor. PRIX DE WEST swerved out into the first turn, went six then five wide on that bend, settled towards the rear, was asked late on the backstretch, raced three wide on the far turn and failed to respond. BASTION bore out ten wide on the first turn, dropped in some near the five-eighths pole, steadied briefly near the nine-sixteenths, floated out on the far turn and faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Mugsy Fury
ENTRY.OWNER: Furey III Charles and Davis Marguerite
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated inside,just off pace,asked 2nd turn,no match,missed tri

ENTRY.COMMENT: 2p1st turn,reserved,ins2nd turn,came out 1/4,no factor
